intro: Demorchis selabintanensis, commonly known as the Selabintan endemic, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories, preferring rich, well-drained soil. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
